message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with source and channel coding problems, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The use of action-dependent side information and additional signal reconstruction requirements suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the signal processing (cs.SI) and multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. The consideration of discrete memoryless systems suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the characterization of single letter expressions for the rate-distortion-cost function and channel capacity suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
